location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Medical reports issued by the civil surgeon at Muscat and the Residency Apothecary at Bushire on Lewis Pelly's illness at Bushire

physicalDescription.extent: The file has been foliated in the top right corner of the recto of each folio with a pencil number enclosed in a circle. Some of the folios have been renumbered and the old numbering has been crossed through to indicate it is no longer in use.

mods.abstract: Reports relating to illnesses suffered by Lewis Pelly from 25 September to 03 November 1871:Envelope labelled 'Medical Certificates' with no contents f. 1Account by Ahmed Khan, Residency Apothecary, dated 7 October 1871, of his treatment of Lewis Pelly's illness from 25 September to 7 October 1871 f. 2Summary of the case of Colonel Pelly, written by H M Meiklejohn, Civil Surgeon at Muscat, describing Pelly's illness from 20 October to 3 November 1871 ff. 3-4.
